title: Patient-reported vision impairment in low luminance relates to visual function in age ... - Nature

summary.text: The Vision Impairment in Low Luminance (VILL) questionnaire effectively captures vision-related quality of life for individuals with AMD in low-luminance situations, focusing on challenges like reading and mobility.

Linear regression analysis shows a significant relationship between VILL subscale scores and visual function assessments including BCVA, LLVA, MA, and PR-CS, highlighting the relevance of these measures for assessing functional impacts of AMD.
The study underscores the importance of considering both eyes in evaluating visual impairment in AMD patients, as it significantly influences vision-related quality of life.
